bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
This is a tracking bug for Change: Rust Compiler For more details, see: https://fedoraproject.org//wiki/Changes/RustCompiler
Introduce packages for the Rust compiler and its Cargo build system.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.

On 2016-July-26, we have reached Fedora 25 Change Checkpoint: Completion deadline (testable).
At this point, all accepted changes should be substantially complete, and testable. Additionally, if a change is to be enabled by default, it must be enabled at Change Completion deadline as well.
Change tracking bug should be set to the MODIFIED state to indicate it achieved completeness.
Incomplete and non testable Changes will be reported to FESCo on 2016-July-29 meeting.

The new packages are only testable in my copr right now: https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/jistone/rust/
Their review requests are marked as bugs this depends on: rust: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1356907 cargo: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1357749
Additionally, I opened a ticket on FPC to get bootstrap exceptions: https://fedorahosted.org/fpc/ticket/643

The rust review is complete, and ready to go in pkgdb. It just needs the exception from FPC, but it appears their meeting today didn't have a quorum.
Igor just started the cargo review.

Rust is in f26, f25-updates-testing (requested stable), and f24-updates.
Cargo is still waiting for a package review. Igor removed himself from this. I've asked a few others if they can do it, and if that doesn't happen soon I'll offer a review-swap on the devel list.
FPC approved the bootstrap exceptions.
Both Rust and Cargo just got pushed to f25-updates! Also, I already updated the next release on rawhide, and will probably push that to f25 and f24 as well.

On 2016-Sep-27 we reached the "Change Checkpoint: 100% Code Complete Deadline" milestone for Fedora 25 release. At this point all the Changes not at least in "ON_QA" state should be brought to FESCo for review. Please update the state of this bug to "ON_QA" if it is already 100% completed. Please let me know in case you have any trouble with the implementation and the Change needs any help or review.
Thanks, Jan
